text:
That's not a cheat, that's a work of genius. The last panel of the last strip and the first panel of this strip go together completely.

Ohhh i wish i could lame this comment.

text: Beef has hugging fantasies involving Tori Amos, but the proper occasion rarely presents itself

text: Tragically, if she were to suddenly drive up, he'd be paralyzed by fear.  Fear and Tetris visions.

text: Ray in that hoodie likes hella hardcore.

name: prolefeed5
text: This really is a singular arc... you would never see Ray that hard.  It's like Achewood Noir... so fucking badass.

name: spinynorman
text:
Like he'd go all ice cold in a hard situation

wear that dead deer as a hat

name: dr_manflesh_desires_anal_play_immediately
text: A comment left by dr_manflesh_desires_anal_play_immediately was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by NeoNaoNeo, yingkaixing, VictoriaW)

name: trollcollins
text: This comment takes multiple cultural and textual references and knits a fine comedy tapestry. I'd give it A , but I'm not a grading body.

name: tim_simmons
text: don't worry. i'll do it for you. A

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Aw shit.
I first thought that said Tori Amos sitting on a birthday cake reading Kant!
In a dominatrix getup.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Ray does what has to be done. He does not flinch from the hard stuff.

name: trollcollins
text: Beef's rarely mentioned thing for Tori Amos makes me happy. She's worth having a thing for!

name: tekende
text: Oh necessarily

name: plezure
text: A comment left by plezure was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by TonyHighwind, hellofditties, cbtbone)

name: deusoma
text:
Actually, the alt text is:
"http://www.whitetails.com/anatomy.html"
Oddly, there's nothing there.

name: zenbot
text:
http://web.archive.org/web/20030801134655/http://www.whitetails.com/anatomy.html

A more completely look at deer anatomy is here:

http://www.bowhunting.net/NAspecies/whitetail2.htm

Ray probably got it right in the heart. He knows how to put a deer out of its misery.

name: gethen
text: if the deer is motionless and the marksman practiced, a heart shot is good, but i'd not have wanted to take the risk of shattering the "shoulderbone" of the front leg (or worse having it deflect the shot). At that range, head and neck are more merciful. But you would better to listen to this man, who is more of an authority on the subject than I will likely ever be. http://sports.expertvillage.com/videos/deer-hunting-taking-shot.htm

name: savage_henry
text: traditionally, you want to hit the killzone- towards the rear of the shoulder. That's your best shot of hitting either the heart or lungs, leading to a clean kill. Aiming for the head or neck leaves very little room for error.

name: gethen
text: Yes, double-lung on a quartering away is my particular choice, but I do not know if I would use the same criteria for hunting as for a mercy shot.  I admit I do not know, since I have not had to administer the latter.  But given the close range I probably would choose the harder shot with the more immediate death (head) over the double lung, since the deer is already in pain.

name: aparrish
text:
ROUGH
CHUCKLES

name: tonyhighwind
text: The neck strikes me as less merciful.  The poor thing's struggling for air in the small moments before it completely dies, and there are enough moments to make dying it's own hell.  Ray made the right call.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: It's on the pavement. Neck or head shot could ricochet back up and kill the little otter. Pete made the right call.

name: tonyhighwind
text: Pete?

name: fallow_fields
text:
here is the new link

http://www.whitetails.com/deer_info/deer_anatomy.cfm

ray got it right in the heart

name: afronaut
text: Am i the only one who can hear the rain in this arc?

name: relaxing
text: The swishing of windshield wipers.

name: sabbac
text: Totally. The whole arc reminded me of Rain

name: lacrimus
text: Food chain!  Get used to it!

name: robobogle
text: Are you saying that cats are higher on the food chain than deer or that otters are?

name: featurelessvoid
text: Well, trucks are, at least.

name: tellumo
text: Well, cats are carnivores, which definitely puts them at a higher trophic level than the deer.

name: snowman
text: Trophic.

name: ocarina654
text: Wow, I was going to rate it 5 for the dramaticness and beautiful artwork, but that last panel... WOW! Elevated this strip beyond what I expected from Achewood, and I have come to expect quite a bit.

name: drycup
text: I use the "I would give x so many hugs right now" line all the time now.

name: taidje_khan
text: Ray brings his pistol on the search for Phillipe. He does not want to kill Nice Pete, but he is not afraid to do what's necessary.

name: tellumo
text: While I do not own a pistol, if I were to embark on a search for Nice Pete, I think my first stop would be to acquire one.

name: drcatastrophe
text: This was the first Achewood I ever read.  I was confused.  It took a bit of backtracking to realize what was happening.

name: hateandwar
text: Help me out here folks. Is there a comic missing from the archive? Seems to me that at the end of this arc before the next one, there was a Thanksgiving comic where like, all the characters and dialogue were scattered all over the place. Like those sticker books you get when you're a kid or something. Teodor was making dinner and Todd shit all over it or something. Does anybody else remember this?

name: tellumo
text: I do remember that, but I think it was a Serializer strip that's now on Webcomics Nation. See here for more information.

name: lobster_mobster
text: Perfect five because of both Beef and the fact that Phillippe didn't die.

name: drago25
text: Man the forest in panels 2 and 7, damned beautiful

name: canusdivinus
text:
I cried the first time I read this strip. The death of the deer is such a beautifully sad way to end this arc.

A young otter lives, an old deer dies. A fair trade.

name: crankheart
text: one of my top 10...hands down.

name: skaterpix
text: i think philippe is the one in need of a hug

name: cracklewater
text:
The shape of the ear-silhouettes changes from being pointy and Pete-like in the last strip to Ray's rounded American curl ears in this one.

Maybe we're seeing Phillipe's panicked perceptions in the last strip, and he assumes it's Nice Pete.

OTOH, I'm still not sure if Phillipe knows Pete is a Bad Man by the end of this arc. As far as I can tell, he was just freaked out by the crusty gelato.

name: thegrumpysnail
text: The artwork in this story arc is hella excellent.

name: rygaud
text: I like to imagine that Ray shooting the deer was not so much putting the deer out of it's misery, but not wanting to have Phillipe have to live with killing the deer, with him being so sensitive and all.

name: carlyle
text: Why did Ray shoot the deer right in front of Phillippe?

name: deus
text:
FOOD CHAIN! GET USED TO IT!

well, that and you cant let a poor animal suffer like that.

name: deus
text: Is this arc finished forever?

name: lucobrazzi88
text: Ray had to shoot it in the torso or else the deer could not have made that return appearance being mounted on the wall in Phillipe's room.... In the strip that has not been drawn yet.

name: deus
text: no, thats where the heart it you shoot them in the heart.

name: kalethan
text: most powerful thread with least speech
